questions.question_text:
A program manager assigns project managers to five component projects and continues to develop the program team.
Which of the following represents the program manager's strategy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In the scenario where a program manager assigns project managers to component projects and continues to develop the program team, the strategy that best represents this action is:

C. Cross-train the project managers to share expertise.

Cross-training project managers in a program environment is a strategic approach to foster collaboration, knowledge sharing, and skill enhancement across the program. By ensuring that project managers are trained in various aspects of the program, not just their specific projects, the program manager is enhancing the overall capability and flexibility of the team. This approach helps in managing interdependencies more effectively and ensures that the team can adapt to changes or challenges within the program. It also promotes a unified understanding of the program's objectives and enhances the team's ability to work cohesively towards common goals.

Selected Answer: D
D is the right answer.

questions.question_text:
The program manager completed the program's benefits analysis and planning activities.
What will this ensure for the program?

choices.A: Prioritize which resources are critical to the project based on an impact analysis of the critical change requests and update the program roadmap.
choices.C: Mandate that no component project change requests will be processed until overdue milestones have been completed and update the risk register to reflect this.
choices.B: Prioritize which change requests are critical to the project based on an impact analysis, resource only critical change requests until overdue milestones are achieved, and update the risk register.
choices.D: Add the lack of skilled resources to facilitate the large number of change requests to the issue log.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the right answer.

Selected Answer: B
B. Prioritize which change requests are critical to the project based on an impact analysis, resource only critical change requests until overdue milestones are achieved, and update the risk register.

This option allows the program manager to manage resources effectively by focusing on the most impactful change requests while also addressing the overdue milestones. By updating the risk register, the program manager acknowledges and documents the issue, which is crucial for transparency and future reference. This approach helps in balancing the need to accommodate necessary changes with the imperative to meet key milestones, thereby maintaining control over the program's progress and resource allocation.

questions.question_text:
A program manager is concerned because several change requests in a component project are causing delays to the program's work package milestones. There are insufficient skilled resources within the component project to complete both the change requests and the milestone tasks.
What should the program manager do next to address this risk?

choices.D: Work with the program sponsor to identify who is responsible for benefits sustainment, and identify measures from the benefits management plan to measure success.
choices.B: Ask the program steering committee to allow program closure to start immediately following the launch of the last component project.
choices.C: Begin to collect lessons learned from all stakeholders, and prepare mitigation strategies in advance of the last component project's launch.
choices.A: Review the benefits management plan to ensure that the first component project launched met stakeholder expectations.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the right answer.

questions.question_text:
Near the end of an ongoing project, the program manager is terminated due to underperformance and a new program manager joins the team. The program's last component project will go live in one week.
What must the new program manager do before program closure?

choices.A: Meet with the vice president of purchasing to discuss the risks associated with preselecting a solution before the requirements have been gathered
choices.C: Ask a senior marketing executive to act as the program sponsor and participate on the steering committee; require steering committee representation from the IT, legal, and other key departments; validate that the chosen solution meets the requirements
choices.B: Host a kick-off meeting; request preliminary requirements from the marketing department; conduct a design session; present the steering committee with a solution that meets the requirements; and meet with interested vendors
choices.D: Initiate the program and begin a formal request for proposal (RFP) to validate the chosen solution and gain the confidence of the legal department
